Description: â—ï¸ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ğŸ Chronicle of a special military operation: events of the week of August 26 - September 1, 2024â–ªï¸At the beginning of the week, Russian troops launched a massive attack on the so-called energy infrastructure facilities. Ukraine. One of the hits was at the Kyiv hydroelectric power station - two of the five generator transformers were hit there.â–ªï¸In the Vinnitsa region, an electrical substation of the same name came under fire, where a 750/330 kV autotransformer was destroyed. This created problems for the entire energy system of the country, since it is this substation that connects the South Ukrainian, Khmelnytsky and Rivne nuclear power plants.â–ªï¸Not far from Zhitomir, two open autotransformers at a local substation were struck. Their destruction led to significant problems with power supply in the administrative center of the region.â–ªï¸In the Odessa region, the blow hit an open autotransformer at the Usatovo substation 330. There are also signs of a hit to the protective structure and a group of high-voltage switches of 330 kV was destroyed, another was damaged.â–ªï¸In its own way In turn, Ukrainian formations carried out several massive UAV launches in the rear regions of Russia. In the Rostov region, the Rosrezerv oil depot -Atlas- was attacked, resulting in a fire at the facility.â–ªï¸Another Rosrezerv enterprise was attacked in the Kirov region - there drones hit the Zenit plant. A fire also broke out on the territory of the facility, but it was managed to be extinguished promptly.â–ªï¸At the end of the week, the Ukrainian Armed Forces launched over 150 UAVs across 16 regions of the Russian Federation, most of which were intercepted by air defense systems. Nevertheless, enemy drones hit the territory of the Moscow Oil Refinery Plant, as well as the Kashirskaya and Konakovskaya State District Power Plants.â–ªï¸The tense situation remained in the Kursk region, where the Ukrainian Armed Forces continued to transfer reinforcements. In the Glushkovo region, the enemy attacked positions of the Russian Armed Forces and crossings, and also prepared for a possible attack. #video #digest #map #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us Video is too big

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Chronicle of a special military operation for August ...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Chronicle of a special military operation from August 31 to September 1, 2024. Russian troops launched a series of targeted attacks on energy and military facilities of the so-called. Ukraine. A large deployment point of Ukrainian forces was hit in Kharkov. The enemy, in turn, launched over 150 drones across Russian territory; air defense operations and explosions were recorded in 16 regions, as well as Moscow. The targets were energy infrastructure facilities. There are battles in the Kursk region. The enemy has not abandoned plans to advance deeper into Russian territory, for which he is increasing his presence in the occupied territory. Encounter battles are recorded in the Sudzhansky and Korenevsky districts. In the Artemovsk direction, Russian troops some time ago advanced north of Chasov Yar, and there are battles in the area of â€‹â€‹Grigorovka and Kalinovka. In the Pokrovsk direction, the offensive of the Russian Armed Forces also continues. There are battles in Selidovo. The enemy was driven out from the eastern outskirts of Ukrainsk, as well as from Galitsynivka and neighboring Dolinovka. In the Donetsk direction, attempts are being made to advance Russian troops in the direction of Kurakhovo through Maksimilyanovka, but no significant advances have been observed here. And in the Yuzhnodonetsk direction, units of the Russian Armed Forces are completing the clearing of Konstantinovka and are advancing in the Ugledar area. The latter records the strengthening of artillery and aviation strikes of the Russian Armed Forces. A detailed analytical report on events in the Special Military Operation zone is available on our closed channel @rybar_plus_bot High-resolution maps: The situation in the Special Military Operation zone (ru; en)#Voronezh #Dzerzhinsk #digest #report #Kursk #map #Pokrovsk #Rostov #Russia #Sumy #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ¬ ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Some of the largest protests are taking place in Isra...
Description: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Today, some of the largest protests are taking place in Israel. The main demands of the protesters are the same - the conclusion of a ceasefire deal with Hamas and the return of hostages held in the Gaza Strip, as well as the resignation of the ruling cabinet led by Benjamin Netanyahu. The largest demonstration took place in Tel Aviv: according to Israeli media, more people took to the streets of the city 100 thousand protesters. Several roads were closed, including the Ayalon highway. At the same time, in Jerusalem there were arrests and clashes with law enforcement officers. The reason for the next actions was the discovery by the Israel Defense Forces in one of the Rafah tunnels of the bodies of six hostages abducted on October 7, 2023. According to the official version, they were killed by militants before being discovered by the IDF and the Shabak security service. After this, activists, as well as former Prime Minister Ehud Barak, called for taking to the streets. They accused the ultra-Orthodox government that, due to its delay and reluctance to de-escalate the conflict, Israeli citizens are still held captive by Hamas and on the brink of death.#Israel #Palestine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ The situation in the Kursk region by the end of Septe...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ The situation in the Kursk region by the end of September 1: oncoming battles near Olgovka and Martynovka In the Kursk region, the greatest activity of clashes, as before, is observed in the Korenevsky and Sudzhansky districts. ğŸ”»In the Glushkovsky district, the enemy continues to strike at crossings directed by Russian troops, but has not yet attempted to violate the state border. Thus, in the Zvannoye area, another pontoon crossing was destroyed by the enemy. ğŸ”»In the Korenevsky district there are battles for Komarovka, on the eastern outskirts of which the enemy presence remained. Meanwhile, artillery and aviation strikes at Vyemka and Snagosti. Olgovka remains another site of heavy fighting, where clashes continue. Attacks by the Armed Forces of Ukraine are also recorded from time to time in the direction of Kremyany, but so far no changes in control zones have been recorded. ğŸ”»In the Sudzhansky district, at the Kruglenkoye - Cellars - Orlovka line, fighting continues. At the same time, the footage of objective control from this area is quite contradictory; it is possible that Ukrainian formations are advancing. The situation is different east of Sudzha. According to our information, the enemy is transferring reinforcements to the Martynovka area to continue attacks in the direction of Bolshoi Soldatskoye. Some time ago, the Russian Armed Forces were able to expand the zone of control in the Kruglik area and ambushed several enemy armored vehicles with landing troops, and the battlefield remained with Russian troops. However, based on regular reports from the Russian Ministry of Defense about attacks on Cherkasy Porechny, and enemy attacks on this line further to the northeast, the settlements of Pravda, Ivashkovsky, Zazulevka and Kubatkin were previously occupied by the enemy. To the south, in the Plekhovo area, a rotation of enemy units and the pull-up of mortars is recorded. At the same time, fighting continues in the vicinity of the village of Borki, but without changes in the zones of control both within the borders of the village and in neighboring Spalnoye. Title: âš›ï¸ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡¯ Why does Kazakhstan need Tajik uranium? -Kazatomprom- ...
Description: âš›ï¸ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡¯ Why does Kazakhstan need Tajik uranium? - Kazatomprom - and - TajRedMet - will jointly search for, mine and process uranium, as well as other rare metals and rare earth elements. The corresponding memorandum between the companies was signed during the recent visit of the President of Kazakhstan Kassym-Jomart Tokayev to Tajikistan.ğŸ“ŒWith the uranium reserves of Tajikistan, everything is not so simple. Both regional and industry media have stated at different times that 14% of its world reserves are concentrated in the republic. Uranium was indeed mined in Soviet Tajikistan, but Tajikistan is not mentioned in the current data of the World Nuclear Association. Kazakhstan's reserves account for 13% of the world's reserves. Considering that with the renaissance of nuclear energy in the world, a new race for uranium has begun, it is likely that Kazatomprom wants to learn more about the current state of Tajik reserves. And, if possible, expand your raw material base. Meanwhile, in Kazakhstan itself, out of more than a dozen projects, only in two are the state a 100% owner. Among Western countries, foreign partners are represented by France, Canada, and Japan. â—ï¸With the hands of Kazatomprom, they will be able to conduct exploration of reserves in the Republic of Tatarstan and assess the prospects for their development. We hope that the domestic Rosatom will also not miss this opportunity.ğŸ”»There is one more point. Kazakhstan's uranium, which lies in sandy soils, is confidently and easily mined. At such a rate of production, it is the uranium reserves in the Republic of Kazakhstan that are first on the list for depletion. Probably, the desire to have a neighborly look into Tajikistan may also be connected with this fact. #Kazakhstan #Tajikistan #CentralAsia@rybarSupport usASIA-PlusKazakhstan and Uzbekistan entered the top five world leaders in uranium productionThe World Nuclear Association published data on uranium production in the world in 2020. The list of 20 countries of the world is headed by Kazakhstan, where last year they produced about 19.5 thousand tons of uranium.

Description: Forwarded From SeveryanochkağŸ‡®ğŸ‡¸ And thatâ€™s not all, by the way. The teachings also reached the once peace-loving Iceland, which was also plagued by general hysteria. The NATO Northern Viking exercise has been taking place there since August 26 and will last until September 3. Iceland, together with the Faroe Islands, is part of the so-called anti-submarine defense line, and if you remember my posts about the importance of the Arctic, you will understand the importance of the island state. Attention to Iceland will also grow. For now, they are limiting themselves to providing their air base and port for the use of the North Atlantic Alliance, but this obviously will not end there. #Great Britain #Iceland #NATO #USASeveryanochka

Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º About international scientometric databases As we have written several times, even two years after the start of the SVO, absurd requirements for the need to publish in journals peer-reviewed by Scopus or WoS remain.ğŸ“ŒNevertheless, positive trends are beginning to be visible. Thus, a draft resolution of the Russian Government appeared, according to which in all other resolutions the wording - articles in journals from the Web of Science and Scopus databases - should be replaced with - articles from the White List of Journals -. The White List includes both foreign and Russian publications, and, most importantly, periodically changes towards the exclusion of garbage publications that publish articles for money. ğŸ”»Such initiatives are welcome. We hope that the draft of this resolution will soon be adopted, and along with it, changes will follow in the lower regulatory legal acts. With such steps, the position of Russian scientists, and with them Russian science, will improve significantly. #science #Russia@rybarSupport usTelegramRybarğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º About the requirements for Russian scientists to publish in Western publications We recently came across amazing news about another outrageous case when the British scientific journal Nature refused Russian physicists in publishing an article in the specialized publication Nature...

Title: Today is the 20th anniversary of one of the worst tragedies in mo...
Description: Today is the 20th anniversary of one of the worst tragedies in modern Russian history - the hostage taking at school No. 1 in Beslan in North Ossetia. The victims of the terrorist attack were 334 people, including 186 children. It was a severe blow for the state and society, and footage of reports from Beslan remained forever before the eyes of many people. However, the country survived, and the fight against terrorism continued with renewed vigor. Over the past years, all the perpetrators and organizers of the terrorist attack were eliminated, the gang underground in the North Caucasus was destroyed, and the only terrorist who survived in Beslan will perish in the Arctic Circle. The country has the power to do everything possible to ensure that such never happened again. And also to preserve the memory of the tragedy and not allow enemies to turn it into their political manifestos and tools of information warfare. Eternal memory to the fallen hostages, service workers, law enforcement officers, special forces soldiers.@rybar

Title: ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡©â˜¦ï¸ Harbingers of a religious war: how Sandu -defends- the Mol...
Description: ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡©â˜¦ï¸ Harbingers of a religious war: how Sandu -defends- the Moldavian Metropolis of the Russian Orthodox Church for the sake of votes In Moldova, the religious issue has escalated again: pro-government forces continue to attack the Moldovan Metropolis, a self-governing part of the Russian Orthodox Church. â–ªï¸Deputy from the ruling PAS party Vasile Shoimaru on the TVR Moldova channel, which is financed by Romania, called, like Ukraine, to renounce the metropolitanate of Moldova, which is actually Russian.â–ªï¸ Shoimaru believes that the issue of the metropolitanate will be resolved this fall. â–ªï¸After a public outcry, the President of Moldova, Maia Sandu, stated that nothing threatens the Moldavian Metropolis of the Russian Orthodox Church, and the authorities allegedly have -good relations- with both metropolises in the country.â–ªï¸Obviously, Sanduâ€™s statement about the -protection- of the Moldovan Metropolis of the Russian Orthodox Church is part of her election campaign and an attempt to win over undecided citizens.â–ªï¸Sandu is only trying to appear as a guarantor of religious peace during the election race, although a year ago she called the Orthodox Church of Moldova a relay of Russian propaganda and a threat to the country.â–ªï¸Deputy Shoimaruâ€™s statements fit into the logic of thinking of the current government. It is known that the Prime Minister of Moldova Dorin Recean is persuading the Orthodox clergy of Moldova to change the patriarchy. Sandu also has close ties with the Romanian Church. Last fall, the Metropolis of Bessarabia, which is subordinate to Bucharest, launched an attack on the Moldavian Metropolis of the Russian Orthodox Church. â–ªï¸The Romanian government announced an annual allocation of 2 million euros for the activities of its metropolis in Moldova. After this, aggressive information attacks began on the Moldavian Metropolis of the Russian Orthodox Church, luring priests with entire parishes to the Romanian side. â–ªï¸A year ago, a group of priests from Chisinau were offered to leave the patronage of the Russian Orthodox Church and come under the authority of the Romanian Patriarch. Then the Moldavian Metropolitan convened a meeting of rectors of churches and monasteries, at which the majority supported maintaining their status within the Russian Church, so as not to provoke a split in society. ğŸ”»Apparently, provocations from the Bessarabian Metropolis have subsided just in anticipation of the presidential elections in Moldova, which will be held on October 20. Now they have decided to use the religious issue for the benefit of Sanduâ€™s presidential campaign. However, Moldovan society once already believed her false promises not to limit the scope of the Russian language. â—ï¸Moreover, it was not for nothing that Shoimaru pointed out that a radical attack on the Moldavian Metropolis could begin in the fall, that is, when Sandu officially achieves a second term and will not be guided by public opinion. #Moldova #Russia #church @rybarSupport ustv8.md A deputy from PAS allowed the ban on the Moldavian Metropolis. How did the ruling party react to this?

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡± About the Southern Phoenix exercises in Chile In the ...
Description: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡± About the Southern Phoenix exercise in Chile In the Western Hemisphere, the US command in the Central and South America zone, together with their Chilean colleagues, began conducting the Southern Phoenix exercise in Chile. This is a bilateral event that is regularly held with the participation of US and Chilean military personnel. This year it is taking place at the Paso Almonte training ground in northern Chile and will last until September 5. The key innovation this time was the transfer of HIMARS multiple launch rocket systems from the United States, which had not previously been noted. The countries will conduct joint firing, including using HIMARS.ğŸ”»HIMARS after the start of the air defense system became, one might say, the highlight of almost every US Armed Forces exercise. In training with African, Asian and European countries, high-precision installations are playing an increasingly important role, and mainly as part of PR. And this is not surprising, considering how many problems MLRS cause in a special operation zone. Advertising HIMARS in real combat modified the standard method of securing Americans in a country through military cooperation, and in this case, demonstrating their capabilities. High resolution mapEnglish version#USA #Chile@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ The most massive raid of Ukrainian UAVs on the Russia...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ The most massive raid of Ukrainian UAVs on Russian regions This night, Ukrainian formations carried out a massive attack of drones on Russian regions. According to the Russian Ministry of Defense, 158 drones were intercepted in 16 regions, as well as over Moscow.â–ªï¸The largest number of ammunition was destroyed over the Kursk region - their number was 46. The work of the air defense of the Russian Armed Forces was recorded throughout the night.â–ªï¸At least 34 Ukrainian drones were intercepted over the Bryansk region. According to Governor Alexander Bogomaz, civilian casualties and destruction of infrastructure were avoided.â–ªï¸14 drones were neutralized in the airspace of the Belgorod region. At the same time, in Belgorod and the Belgorod region, commercial properties, private houses and civilian vehicles suffered material damage. â–ªï¸In the Moscow region and Moscow, a downed UAV fell on a technical building on the territory of the Moscow Oil Refinery in Kapotnya, leading to a fire: its area was about 40 square meters, it was extinguished. According to some reports, the Kashirskaya State District Power Plant was also attacked, but there is no confirmation of this. Also, according to preliminary information, the enemy tried to attack the Zhukovsky airport. Temporary restrictions to ensure flight safety were also introduced on the functioning of the Vnukovo and Domodedovo airports; their operation was restored from 09:05.â–ªï¸In the Tver region, after a drone hit, a fire started at the Konakovo State District Power Plant, which was soon localized and extinguished. According to Governor Igor Rudenya, there were no casualties, electricity and gas supply to the district is carried out as usual.â–ªï¸Air defense systems also worked in Yaroslavl, Voronezh, Ryazan, Kaluga, Tula, Tambov, Smolensk, Oryol and Ivanovo regions; no casualties were recorded. Only in the Tarru district in the Lipetsk region was a cell phone tower damaged.ğŸ”»The night attack of the Ukrainian Armed Forces became the most massive since the beginning of the Northern Military District. Once again, the main targets were the fuel and energy complex facilities, where the enemy specially developed approach routes from the least protected directions. But in this case, only a few UAVs reached the targets, while the rest were destroyed. However, in the foreseeable future, the rate of production of drones by the enemy will be even higher. And you need to be prepared for this - if today the wave of drones on the capital was almost completely destroyed, this does not mean that tomorrow it will be exactly the same. Title: ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡µğŸ‡­ About the developing cooperation between Vietnam and the...
Description: ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡µğŸ‡­ About the developing cooperation between Vietnam and the Philippines An important event for the Asian region was the signing of an agreement of intent between Vietnam and the Philippines to cooperate in the field of security. This happened during the visit of the Vietnamese Minister of Defense to Manila on August 30. â–ªï¸Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has already called the meeting a significant milestone in the history of relations between the two countries. However, it is not yet entirely clear what the parties agreed on - the parties will sign an agreement in the security sphere before the end of this year.â–ªï¸Taking into account the recent exercises of the coast guards of the Philippines and Vietnam, it can be assumed that the agreement will be aimed at increasing interaction in this area. â–ªï¸Perhaps the agreements also concern bilateral training with the participation of the Philippine and Vietnamese navies. Still, we should not forget that China is the main maritime competitor of the countries in the South China Sea. ğŸ”»However, you should not expect anything breakthrough from this agreement. Despite the current popular theses about the need to form a united front from all participants in the territorial dispute against China, their practical implementation will have to wait a very long time. Moreover, now only the Philippines has such a proactive position on the conflict. From Vietnam's point of view, the visit of the Minister of Defense once again emphasizes that Hanoi will not give up its territorial claims. It seems that no one there is planning to change the approach to countering the activity of the PRC - the creation of bulk territories on the quiet and the periodic expulsion of Chinese ships from their waters have so far yielded the desired result. #Vietnam #Philippines@rybar together with @awaken_dragonSupport usNikkei AsiaPhilippines and Vietnam sign defense agreementLetter of intent marks strengthening of bilateral relations

Title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡¿ğŸ›¢You canâ€™t stop downloading: in Astana they canâ€™t choose whe...
Description: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡¿ğŸ›¢You canâ€™t stop pumping: in Astana they canâ€™t choose where to put a comma for OPEC+. Kazakhstan is preparing a corrective oil production plan for 2024 due to the need to fulfill obligations under the OPEC+ agreement, said the Minister of Energy of the Republic of Kazakhstan Almasadam Satkaliev. In fact, the minister admitted that Astana systematically fails to fulfill its obligations under the deal. The rubber has been hanging on since March of this year - even then Kazakhstan exceeded its obligations by 131 thousand barrels per day. In July the numbers were approximately the same. ğŸ“ŒKazakhstan controls only part of the production, and therefore it can only reduce its share, which occurs by reducing supplies to refineries and exports. The decline in exports reduces revenues to the National Fund, which contradicts the statements of the government, which is increasingly using its funds. But Astana is also not ready to cut budget expenditures, since this could cause social discontent and disruptions in infrastructure maintenance. And maintaining excess production will contribute to a decline in oil prices, which will also lead to a decrease in income. ğŸ”»The government has taken on obligations that it is unable to fulfill, driving itself into a trap in pursuit of the petrodollar and raking out the entire pot to the bottom. A successful exit from the vicious circle is not yet in sight, and something suggests that this will soon affect Kazakhstanâ€™s relations with Arab countries. #Kazakhstan #CentralAsia@rybarSupport usInterfaxKazakhstan will adjust the 2024 oil production plan within the framework of the OPEC+ agreement 2024 due to the need to fulfill obligations under the OPEC+ agreement, Energy Minister Almasadam Satkaliev told Interfax.

Title: ğŸ”ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡«ğŸ‡® Since the Fishermen are talking about a new phase o...
Description: Forwarded From SeveryanochkağŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡«ğŸ‡® Since the Fishermen are talking about a new phase of active military exercises around the world, I would add that a similar thing is observed in the good old north. In Finland, two flight tactical trainings were recently completed - Pristine Flank and Ilmataktiikka, which took place from August 26 to 28 and from August 26 to 30, respectively. About 1 thousand military personnel from three countries took part in it - Finland, the USA and Sweden. From the Finns there were training aircraft and 22 F/A-18s, and from the Americans and the Swedes - MC-130J and C-130H, which flew to Tikkakoski. The tasks, in principle, remained unchanged, air combat, cover for special aviation for the drop of troops, the involvement of aircraft controllers and so on. This is still not so important for ordinary readers. What is more important is the realization that Finland now is practically the same as the Baltic states after joining NATO. There will be a lot of provocative maneuvers, increased press attention and inflating the imaginary threat from Russia. But underneath all this there will be hidden something extremely important and interesting, such as the equipment of bases, training grounds, trenches, defensive structures and testing offensive tactics in the northern Russian regions. #VSRF #Russia #FinlandSeveryanochka

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡¿ğŸ—³ Today, early elections to the National Assembly are bei...
Description: ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡¿ğŸ—³ Today, early elections to the National Assembly are being held in Azerbaijan. Back in June 2024, the board of the New Azerbaijan party recommended holding elections ahead of schedule in November, allegedly because of the UN climate conference (COP29). However, the real reasons for the rush are, of course, different. These elections, first of all, are designed to consolidate the status of Karabakh within Azerbaijan through the election of legal representatives in parliament from these territories and the population living on them. The formally declared reason related to COP29 is secondary. ğŸ”»After the elections, we can expect Azerbaijan to increase pressure on Armenia in order to speed up the signing of a peace treaty and hold a constitutional referendum, formalizing Armeniaâ€™s renunciation of claims to Karabakh. High-resolution infographics Russian version #Azerbaijan #elections@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ” #Review #Summary for the morning of September 1, 2024 â–ªï¸ The p...
Description: Forwarded From Two Majors#Review #Report for the morning of September 1, 2024â–ªï¸ The past week began with a massive attack on enemy rear targets. Military and economic damage was caused to the enemy, but no explosions occurred at symbolic objects like the Verkhovna Rada, despite the expectations of the Western press after the start of the Kursk operation of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. â–ªï¸ The defensive operation of the Russian Armed Forces in the Kursk region continues for the fourth week. The drawn up reserves made it possible to pin down the enemy in battles; the Ukrainian Armed Forces are conducting constant attacks in several directions, trying to push through our battle formations. Due to the absence of a continuous front line, the enemy resorts to methods of maneuver warfare, trying to separate our forces. Against the backdrop of attacks on Lgov, the head of the city again called on those who left for the rear areas not to return until the situation stabilizes. â–ªï¸ The enemy retains reserves for attacks on the Belgorod, Bryansk, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions. Kyiv believes that the goals of such actions are the seizure of important logistics and energy facilities for further exchange in negotiations, which are out of the question at the moment. â–ªï¸ At the same time, the actions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the Kursk region and the aforementioned preservation of reserves in the planned offensive directions do not give Kyiv the opportunity to stabilize the front in the Pokrovsky direction. As a result of heavy fighting, the Russian Armed Forces significantly advanced or occupied important positions on a 60 km front from Grodovka to the approaches to the Ugledar defensive hub. Thus, in the south of the Pokrovsky direction, the enemy was forced to flee Karlovka, which he held for months, and was unable to organize defense in Galitsynovka. The pace of the offensive raises concerns among some Russian experts about the risks of stretching the logistics of the Russian Army.â–ªï¸ In the Toretsk (Dzerzhinsk) direction, our troops are also developing success in heavy intense battles: the battles are taking place on the outskirts of Toretsk itself. It should be noted that the Ukrainian Armed Forces have been building this defensive area since 2014.â–ªï¸ This week, the Russian Ministry of Defense also reported that Sinkovka and Stelmakhovka were liberated in the Kupyansk direction.â–ªï¸ The situation when in the Kursk direction the Ukrainian Armed Forces managed to achieve success at the initial stage against border guards and conscripts, and in other directions the enemy often simply runs, which may be due not only to the incorrect situation by the command of the group of forces -North, responsible for the Kharkov and Kursk directions, but also to the deployment of battle-hardened units and subunits in the directions that were successful for us. Thus, in the Kursk direction, the enemy was pinned down by battles and inflicting extremely sensitive damage on the front-line soldiers transferred from other sectors: 810 OGBRMP, 155 OGBRMP, 56 DShP, group -Aida- and other combat units of the Special Forces -Akhmat-, as well as other experienced units .â–ªï¸ The Ukrainian Armed Forcesâ€™ strikes on our energy facilities remain an important element of the situation. Despite the fact that the lion's share of enemy drones are destroyed in the air, the enemy effectively knocks out the oil refinery. Todayâ€™s attack on the Konakovo State District Power Plant also shows that Ukraine is solving the task assigned to it by the West of inflicting maximum economic and military damage on Russia. At the same time, outright bungling in organizing the fight against enemy UAVs is still present. â–ªï¸ Forecasts for the development of the situation by our military indicate the continuation of the enemyâ€™s plans to organize offensive actions in the above directions, as well as try to occupy the spits of the Kherson region at any cost, as was the case in Krynki. The latter is necessary for the Ukrainian Armed Forces to organize a sea corridor from the ports of Nikolaev. Nobody cares how many soldiers Kyiv will lose. The renewal of the enemy's manpower is solved through total mobilization and its training in Western countries. At the same time, the absence of consequences for Kyiv and NATO for -crossing red lines- entails an escalation of the conflict and an increase in the damage caused to Russia. The summary was compiled by: Two majors

Title: ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¹ About the Moroccan-Ethiopian military agreement in the H...
Description: ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¹ About the Moroccan-Ethiopian military agreement In the countries of the Horn of Africa, quite noticeable events are taking place by the standards of the region: while the Somali government is changing course in search of international partners and even trying to build bridges with Russia, the situation in Ethiopia is building differently.â–ªï¸Currently in Addis Abbebe is intensifying interaction with the collective West, including the United States. An additional catalyst is Ethiopia's recognition of the independence of the self-proclaimed state of Somaliland this year.â–ªï¸At the same time, the Ethiopian authorities also continue to look for allies on the African continent from among pro-Western countries. Morocco is one of these.â–ªï¸So in July the parties exchanged military delegations, and during one of the last ones in Morocco from August 25 to 29, an agreement on military cooperation was signed. So far, its terms remain unknown, but they have been preparing for its signing for quite a long time. â–ªï¸ Against this background, it seems funny that the Ethiopian authorities condemned the deployment of the Egyptian contingent in Somalia. Allegedly, a large military contingent, designed to at least ensure the security of large cities from the threat of terrorists, will become a factor of destabilization. The separatist authorities in Somaliland made a similar statement. It is still unknown what the further steps of the West and regional players in the confrontation over the Horn of Africa will lead to. The situation at the moment is tense and more and more contradictions are accumulating between the parties. One way or another, intervention is the last thing they will do in Addis Ababa. Somali territory is infested with Al-Shabab militants, who have also become active in the territories controlled by the Ethiopian armed forces. #Africa #Morocco #Somalia #Ethiopia@rybarSupport usMorocco World NewsMorocco, Ethiopia Strengthen Military Ties During High-Level Meetings in RabatSupreme Commander and Chief of General Staff of the Royal Armed Forces (FAR) hosted Marshal Birhanu Jula Gelalcha, Chief of General Staff of the Ethiopian National Defense Forces, for an official visit to Morocco from August 25 to 29.

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Aggravation in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict zone ...
Description: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Aggravation in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict zone chronicle of events for August 30-31, 2024 In the north of the Gaza Strip, Israeli troops attacked both the capital of the Palestinian enclave and the satellite town of Jabaliya. As a result of the hits, residential buildings and civilian infrastructure were damaged. In the central part of the enclave, the Israeli operation south of Deir al-Balah ended. However, in the city itself, humanitarian problems continue to worsen, caused by both a lack of drinking water and a lack of sufficient quantities of medicine. Also, the operation of Israeli troops ended in the Khan Yunis area, from the vicinity of which IDF units were withdrawn yesterday. Meanwhile, Israeli engineering work is underway in Rafah to create a buffer zone on the border with Egypt. Major raids continue in the West Bank, as a result of which Israeli security forces detained several dozen people. The most violent clashes occurred in Jenin, where at least five local militants were killed. The tense situation remains on the Lebanese-Israeli border. Over the past two days, Hezbollah has launched several dozen rockets into northern Israel, but most of them were either intercepted or fell in vacant lots. ğŸ”»A detailed analytical report on events in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict zone is available on our closed channel @rybar_plus_botHigh resolution mapEnglish version#digest #map #Israel #Palestine #report@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ”ğŸ–¼ The main problem of modern American AUGs, in addition to the...
Description: Forwarded From Cats and Kramnik's cat The main problem of modern American AUGs, in addition to the loss of a significant part of the capabilities that they possessed 40 years ago, is the loss of the ability of the US Navy and the defense industry as a whole to quickly adapt to the changed strategic situation, due to a reduction in the range of projects and an increase in their terms implementation. Moreover, the latter, in addition to the natural complication of technology as it develops, is also dictated by a host of reasons from the sphere of management, only indirectly related to technology as such. The companyâ€™s desire to cut the pie itâ€™s got for a longer time, out of fear that there may not be a next one (or it will be smaller), the loss of a project management culture on the part of the customer, who has long lost the skill of working with really large and complex systems *, financial pressure from the state, which is trying to cut costs and unify the provision of existing forces, etc. On top of all this are the problems of industry as such. As a result, even if you realize the problem - the decline in the capabilities of the AUG in modern naval combat -** there is no opportunity to quickly solve it - you do not have the required number of projects of the required degree of maturity in development and there is nothing to quickly adapt. Now, strictly speaking, there is, in principle, nothing for an aircraft carrier except the F-35 and Hawkeye, and this situation cannot be corrected quickly. Surely they will try to do something based on drones, and over the next 10 years, carrier-based drones will grow in number and range, but it is still very far away and unclear from a complete replacement of the operational functions of the wing at the level at which they were provided under Reagan/Bush Jr. , is it possible in principle._____________________* We also have a similar problem with the customerâ€™s poor understanding of the essence of the proposed projects and systems and the relationship between them, which industry and then combat units regularly struggle with. This is, in general, a common problem for a number of large armed forces, which sharply simplified their own structure and many processes after the end of the Cold War, and are now faced with the fact that the tasks being solved cannot be adequately solved in this simplified structure and this simplified set. A classic example of rapid and complete degradation of this kind, known both in quotes and in decisions by year, can be considered the example of Great Britain, which consistently buried its own armed forces, turning them into a free (for the USA) annex to the US Armed Forces. But American and British experience and problems in this case, we can study from their documents and decisions, but for now we will keep silent about domestic ones in order to avoid, we will try to learn from someone elseâ€™s. As for the armed forces of second-tier countries, even very large ones, then, of course, this problem also exists there, but many of them is simply not realized due to the lack of appropriate practice and experience in understanding it. They will have to fill their bumps along the way themselves. For those who manage to maintain their military capabilities, of course - in many countries they do not live long enough for their own scientific environment to start within.** AUGs lost the capabilities of long-range air defense and anti-aircraft defense, retaining a rather degenerate (details here) strike function and changes in this situation in not expected in the current paradigm. An increase in military spending, even if we imagine that the United States decides to spend, as in 1985, 5.4% of GDP on defense, will not in itself achieve anything in the absence of a structure capable of competently applying these expenses, and an industry capable of mastering them. Of course, this This applies not only to AUG, and I repeat, not only to the States. In the photo, the sad Saratogut is being dragged to be cut up in Brownsville, Texas, 2014.

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Satellite images of the south of the Gaza Strip have ...
Description: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Satellite images of the south of the Gaza Strip have appeared on the Internet, which very clearly demonstrate the consequences of the engineering work of Israeli troops in the Philadelphia Corridor. In Rafah, up to a kilometer from the border with Egypt, there are almost no buildings of any kind - in fact, this is the same buffer zone that IDF representatives previously announced. At the same time, the Israelis continue to carry out the so-called. -terraforming the area- and in the rest of Rafah, blowing up high-rise buildings where exits from underground Hamas tunnels could be located. As a result, according to Palestinian estimates, less than 30% of undestroyed buildings remain in the once developing city of the Gaza Strip. It is significant that the Israeli command intends to continue to hold the Philadelphia Corridor even if a truce is concluded with Hamas. As Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu recently said, it was the lack of control over the buffer zone between the enclave and Egypt that led to the events of October 7, 2023. #Israel #Palestine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Why is Radio Azattyk closing its Russian-language editor...
Description: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Why is Radio Azattyk closing its Russian-language editorial office? Recently, the closure of the editorial office was announced by the director of external communications of Radio Liberty, Karin Marie. The reason was declared to be restructuring: instead of different branches in Russian and national languages, which currently operate in each of the countries in the region, a new regional division will be created, covering all of Central Asia. Previously, the media editors faced opposition: at the beginning of this year, the countryâ€™s Ministry of Foreign Affairs refused accreditation 36 journalists of Radio Azattyk, accusing the media of violating the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan. The situation was later resolved. Last year there was an unsuccessful attempt by the authorities to shut down broadcasting in Kyrgyzstan. ğŸ“ŒApparently, attempts to limit work have led to the use of a new strategy. Deputy head of the National Research Institute of Communications Valentina Komleva noted that Western donors have now directed resources to create an extensive network of bloggers. It is more difficult for the state to control it, unlike the editorial office, which works from one point. Therefore, there is nothing to be happy about here. Moreover, in conditions when a Euronews representative office was opened in Astana, ready to take on professional journalism, the Americans decided to optimize resources and not duplicate structures with similar tasks. In addition, the creation of a structure with a single control center emphasizes that a course has been taken towards regional integration. This is not a new tactic in the region: the somewhat previously odious Soros Foundation closed regional offices in the countries of Central Asia and began to operate as a supranational structure called CAPS Unlock - Central Asian Political Studies. Thus, from individual NGOs in each Central Asian country, the Foundation has grown into a single think tank with a large-scale network of research and influence extending across the entire region and headquartered in Almaty. It was not difficult to select a team for this from already proven employees of the regional representative offices of NPOs in Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan. ğŸ”»It is likely that this tactic will be used by Radio Azattyk. In this case, you can try to predict and track further stages of transformation. There is one interesting nuance: the restructuring process has been announced (perhaps for now) only in Kazakhstan. #Kazakhstan #CentralAsia@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Kursk direction: battles in the Sudzhansky region and...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Kursk direction: fighting in the Sudzhansky region and the defeat of equipment in the rear areas of the Armed Forces of Ukraine situation towards the end of August 31, 2024 In the Kursk direction, a tense situation remains in several sectors of the front at once. Russian troops hit armored vehicles and fire support equipment behind enemy lines. Ukrainian formations are not giving up attempts to advance in the Korenevsky and Sudzhansky districts. ğŸ”»In the Glushkovsky district the situation has not undergone significant changes. Ukrainian formations are striking at pontoon crossings established by the Russian Armed Forces to supply the group at the Tetkino-Glushkovo line. ğŸ”»In the Korenevsky district, the Armed Forces of Ukraine launched several attacks in the direction of the village of Matveevka, all of them were repelled by Russian units. â–ªï¸The situation in the Kremyany area remains unchanged; after unsuccessful attacks of previous days, the enemy is regrouping its forces and transferring reserves to resume attempts to take control of the settlement. ğŸ”»In the Sudzhansky district, Ukrainian formations were able to slightly advance from the west to the village of Pogrebki, taking up positions in several forest belts. One of the concentration areas of the Armed Forces of Ukraine was hit by Russian aviation using FAB-3000 with UMPC. â–ªï¸To the south, the enemy also launched unsuccessful attacks in the direction of Malaya Loknya and Bakhtinka. In Martynovka, Russian artillery covered the position of an Ukrainian Armed Forces UAV crew on the eastern outskirts of the village. Also west of Sudzha, Russian Armed Forces drone operators successfully hit an enemy T-72 tank on the march. ğŸ”»Russian intelligence was able to detect launch positions of missile systems of Ukrainian formations in a forest area west of Guevo. During a missile strike, units of the Russian Armed Forces destroyed an M270 MLRS launcher, with the help of which the Ukrainian Armed Forces, among other things, strike crossings in the Glushkovsky region. Title: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡³ About the visit of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Se...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡³ About the visit of the Senegalese Foreign Minister to Moscow On August 29, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov held talks with his Senegalese counterpart Yacine Fall. During the meeting, the new governmentâ€™s Russia-friendly rhetoric was confirmed and some attractive prospects opened up.â–ªï¸Among them are interesting projects for domestic businessâ€”KAMAZâ€™s initiative to build a plant in an African country received new impetus. Negotiations about this have been going on since 2017, but they hardly got off the ground, limiting themselves to words. Now, what is noteworthy, despite Western sanctions, dialogue in this direction has been launched again.â–ªï¸In addition, the parties agreed to take steps to implement joint projects in energy and geological exploration. And all this coincides with the beginning of oil production in the country, although for now by Anglo-Saxon companies. Of course, until the agreement is supported on paper, the issue is hanging in the air and more active actions are needed on the part of Russian companies. Moreover, as in Tanzania, the activities of the intergovernmental trade and economic commission have intensified.â–ªï¸The latest scandal related to the Kyiv regimeâ€™s alleged support for terrorists in the Sahel has not gone unnoticed. Then the Senegalese authorities reacted quite harshly, by the standards of the pro-French ECOWAS bloc, to the words of the Ukrainian ambassador who supported the GUR. Then the question of his expulsion from the country even arose. Lavrov expressed his approval of the neutrality of the Senegalese authorities in the conflict, in contrast to those countries where the head of Ukrainian diplomacy flew during his tour.ğŸ”»Despite the fact that the new Senegalese government still maintains strong relations with France, the Senegalese authorities are trying with all their might to demonstrate their multi-vector nature. And this, of course, needs to be used by both Russian diplomacy and the business community.#Africa #Russia #Senegal@rybarSupport usRIA NovostiLavrov discussed projects in the field of geological exploration with the head of the Foreign Ministry of SenegalRussian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said that during negotiations with the head of the Foreign Ministry Senegal's Yacine Fall discussed projects in the field of geological exploration, development... Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Pokrovsko-Kurakhovskoe direction: battles in Selidovo...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Pokrovsko-Kurakhovskoe direction: fighting in Selidovo and the liberation of most of Galitsynivkasituation as of 18:00 on August 31, 2024 In the Pokrovsko-Kurakhovskoe direction, the Armed Forces of Ukraine continue to lose more and more positions. Russian troops suppress pockets of enemy resistance and advance towards Kurakhovo, gradually encircling the Ukrainian Armed Forces group to the east. â–ªï¸In Selidovo, assault groups of the Russian Armed Forces established control over the territory of the city park and the Avangard stadium. Now Russian troops are fighting in the area of â€‹â€‹Gogol Street, beyond which begins the sector of apartment buildings used by the enemy to build defenses in the city. To the south, advanced groups of Russian attack aircraft reached 8 September Street, knocking out the Ukrainian Armed Forces from several positions. Local residents report active artillery activity in the area of â€‹â€‹the Malvina kindergarten, where the line of combat contact probably currently lies. â—ï¸West of Nagornaya Street there is a block of multi-storey buildings, which Ukrainian forces will likely seek to turn into a key defensive hub. Successfully overcoming the resistance of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in this area will allow the Russian Armed Forces to gain a foothold in the territory of the quarter and prevent the enemy from organizing a fortified line of defense. â–ªï¸To the south, Russian troops, according to available information, liberated the settlement of Dolinovka, abandoned by the enemy due to the lack of opportunities to hold it. To the east, the Russian Armed Forces established control over most of Galitsynovka, knocking out the Ukrainian Armed Forces from positions on the southern bank of the Volchaya River. According to some information, advanced groups of Russian infantry have already entered the territory of Zhelanny First, while most of the enemy units have retreated from the populated area. â—ï¸Some sources also report the beginning of battles for Ukrainsk, but so far it is not possible to confirm this with objective control personnel and information from the field. ğŸ”»The combat situation for the Armed Forces of Ukraine, apparently, is deteriorating more and more rapidly. Russian troops are actively advancing towards Kurakhovo, the enemyâ€™s key transport hub, which poses a threat to the supply of several Ukrainian Armed Forces groups in other directions of the front. In addition, the situation in the Nevelskoye area remains unclear: according to unconfirmed reports, there is still a Ukrainian presence in the fields to the west of it formation. In this case, the advance of units of the RF Armed Forces towards Kurakhovo will actually mean that they will be surrounded. Title: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡· Blocking X in Brazil is a precedent for the whole world ...
Description: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡· Blocking X in Brazil is a precedent for the whole world As a result of blocking the platform in the largest South American country, Muskâ€™s company and all structures friendly to him were faced with the problem of losing the largest and -extremely desirable - (as some Western media write) media market, which flourished during the period of right-wing President Jair Bolsonaro is in power.â–ªï¸Itâ€™s no joke to lose more than 20 million users, provided that the platform lives off advertising. However, given the pressure from the opposing group of Western elites associated with the Democratic Party, this is becoming increasingly difficult to do. And if Kamala Harris takes the White House in January, the situation for the Musk group will become even worse. â–ªï¸However, itâ€™s not just Musk who is under fireâ€”Mark Zuckerberg recently admitted to Congress that the White House put pressure on his platforms to censor content. As some experts suggest, he did this in case of a possible victory for Donald Trump in the upcoming elections. â–ªï¸The situation with the situation of X in Brazil is significant because it is developing simultaneously with the arrest of Telegram owner Pavel Durov. Both events were (and are) accompanied by an active media campaign in the foreign segment regarding the dissemination of prohibited content, disinformation and incitement of radical sentiments on these platforms. ğŸ“ŒIt goes without saying that they wrote more actively about Telegram, but most recently Frida @sex_drugs_kahlo talked about Xâ€™s dissatisfaction on the part of the UK authorities, who condemned Muskâ€™s support for right-wing protesters and expressed claims that sound even more fun than the ruling from the Supreme Court of Brazil. ğŸ”»Based on all of the above, it makes sense to talk about a new round of development of the digital market: most likely, a legal mechanism for regulating behavior in the online space will be formed, the virtual police apparatus will be officially consolidated, and after it the punitive apparatus. The era of digital freedom is officially approaching to its end.@rybar#Brazil #USASupport usTelegramRybarğŸ‡§ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ About blocking X in Brazil On Friday, the South American country's Supreme Court Judge Alexandri de Moraes ruled to temporarily block the platform due to Elon Musk's refusal to appoint a legal representative of the company in the country within the prescribed period ( toâ€¦

Title: ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ About the blocking of X in Brazil On Friday, a judge of ...
Description: ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ About the blocking of X in Brazil On Friday, the Supreme Court judge of the South American country, Alexandri de Moraes, ruled to temporarily block the platform due to Elon Muskâ€™s refusal to appoint a legal representative of the company in the country by the deadline (until Thursday evening).â–ªï¸In his ruling, Moraes indicated that the work of X is suspended until the management of the social network fulfills all legal requirements: it is still required to appoint a local representative and pay more than three million dollars in fines.â–ªï¸The telecommunications regulator responsible for the blocking told Western media that it was beginning to enforce decisions of the Supreme Court, but did not indicate the exact deadlines for execution. â–ªï¸Earlier, Moraesâ€™ ruling also included a requirement to fine individuals and legal entities up to nine thousand dollars per day if they tried to use the platform using a VPN. However, a few hours later Moraes withdrew this sanction. â–ªï¸Elon Musk, the owner of the social network, has already accused Moraes of trying to apply unreasonable censorship and of -closing the No. 1 source of truth in Brazil.- Muskâ€™s statements have already been supported by some American Republican officials; Moraes, however, was not impressed. He insists that social networks need to be regulated because of incitement to hatred.â–ªï¸The situation was also commented on by the president of the South American country, Lula da Silva: he insisted that all businesses operating in the country must comply with legal obligations. Even if they have a lot of money.â–ªï¸Musk ridiculed the statement of the Brazilian leader, and called him a -lap dog.- Judge Moraes became a dictator.ğŸ”»Where did it all start? On August 17, the management of the social network X announced the closure of its office in Brazil, simultaneously accusing the Brazilian authorities of censorship. It was alleged that the day before Judge Moraes threatened a company representative with arrest if X did not comply with the court's orders. Even earlier - in April - the Supreme Court of Brazil included Elon Musk in an investigation concerning the spread of fake news in X and Musk's refusal to comply with di Moraes' order by removing those involved in eom a number of accounts on social networks. A separate investigation was also launched against the owner of X for obstructing the investigation. As a result of all the legal vicissitudes, Starlink bank accounts in Brazil, which were involved in the investigation into fakes, have now also been frozen. However, Starlink continues to provide free service to Brazilians (including military personnel) and on Friday submitted a petition to lift the block, which was rejected. @rybar in collaboration with @sex_drugs_kahlo#Brazil #USSupport usTelegramÂ¿Por quÃ© no te callas?ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡· Without waiting, While the draconian measure on fines for VPN use is considered illegal, Judge Morais simply abandoned it by editing his ruling. Well that's good

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ In the Asia-Pacific region, the situation with re...
Description: ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ In the Asia-Pacific region, the situation with regular provocations and demonstrative maneuvers from both China and the United States and allies began to gain some stability.â–ªï¸The Chinese responded to several exercises that had begun, as well as American bomber flights in the Bay of Bengal , sent their reconnaissance aircraft to the Japanese shores. The command of the Japanese Self-Defense Forces reported that a Chinese electronic warfare aircraft approached the Danjio Islands so close that F-15 fighters were scrambled into the air to escort them.â–ªï¸In the South China Sea, the Chinese also responded demonstratively: to the increased frequency flights of the American MQ-4C UAV -Triton- in the Middle Kingdom sent fighters and a KJ-500 AWACS aircraft. Considering that -Triton- is called the naval version of the RQ-4B, and in this area clashes between Chinese and Philippine sailors regularly occur, what was the MQ-4C reconnaissance over the waters of the South China Sea is clear. This is the modern reality of the Asia-Pacific region, where a relatively stable region in which the main struggle unfolded in the information space has turned into a new arena of confrontation between geopolitical opponents. High resolution mapEnglish version#China #USA #Japan@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ¬ ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Every day in the Gaza Strip the problem with the expo...
Description: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Every day in the Gaza Strip the problem with waste disposal is becoming more and more aggravated: almost every day on the Internet you can find footage of mountains of garbage in various parts of the enclave. The situation is most acute in Deir al-Balah and Khan Yunis, where, against the backdrop of regular strikes and occasional IDF offensives, the work of municipal services was virtually paralyzed. Long-term persistence of the garbage problem increases the risk of all kinds of epidemics, including polio, the first case of which in 25 years has already been recorded in the center of the Gaza Strip. The situation is also complicated by the rather dense population living in tents in the humanitarian zone, which leads to a faster spread of diseases. At the same time, at the beginning of the week, over a million polio vaccines were delivered to the enclave - they are gradually distributed among the remaining medical facilities. And although preparations for the vaccination campaign are in active progress, its implementation may require quite a lot of time due to the shortage of medical personnel, as well as the small number of working hospitals. #Israel #Palestine@rybarSupport us

Description: â—ï¸ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Kursk direction: expansion of the zone of control of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the Sudzhansky region Situation as of 13:00 on August 31, 2024 Over the past few days, the situation in the Kursk region remained steadily tense, but without significant changes in the configuration of the front. Ukrainian mobile groups are trying to advance in several areas, while Russian troops are responding with targeted strikes against identified targets.â–ªï¸On the northern flank, Ukrainian Armed Forces units launched attacks on the Malaya Loknya - Nechaev - Nizhnyaya Parovaya line. Description: âš¡ï¸ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ğŸ– #Comic from Rybar No. 29: Once upon a time on that very street With daily reports from the fields and descriptions of positional battles, a rare reader will be able to imagine how difficult it is in reality to advance even just two hundred meters. After all, while the attack aircraft take up a new position, the main forces can pull closer or move unnoticed. Itâ€™s good to talk about all this while being safe, but under fire, constantly risking the lives of both your own and your comrades, it can be very difficult to walk even 200-300 meters . Videos of flag hoisting often show relatively minor destruction, indicating a relatively rapid retreat of the enemy. At the same time, it is impossible to talk about the collapse of the front, much less an easy walk. Ukrainian formations are resisting, trying to delay the liberation of Donbass. â–ªï¸ Fighting continues in Grodovka. At the same time, for the second day now rumors have been appearing on the Internet about Russian reconnaissance groups reaching the outskirts of Mirnograd - this is supported by reports of the capture of Nikolaevka by Russian troops. â–ªï¸ The situation west of Novogrodovka is still hidden - by the fog of war -, but fighting continues for Selidovo. Neighboring Galitsinovka and Dolinovka, according to incoming information, by the end of August 30 also came under the control of Russian troops, after which battles for the Zhelannye First began. At the same time, there are no objective control personnel yet, which is why such rates of advancement look too high.â–ªï¸ But there are no doubts about the control of the Russian Armed Forces over neighboring Karlovka. Description: Forwarded From Systemic PesticideğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ About the hearings of the US Helsinki Commission on Armenia The Helsinki Commission (US Mission to the OSCE) announced a hearing for September 10 on the topic -Supporting democracy in Armenia and its Western future-. â–ªï¸The commission is formed from among employees of the State Department, as well as members of Congress. ğŸ“ŒThe hearings on Armenia are timed to coincide with the results of the visit of senators and members of the Helsinki Commission to Yerevan in July. Then the Americans persistently discussed the closure of the Armenian nuclear power plant, which is serviced by the Russian Federation. In exchange, members of the US delegation promised to build an American station. The purpose of the visit was said to be to distance the republic from Russia. â–ªï¸At the hearing, the commission will support all these theses, because the announcement indicates that they will discuss ways in which the United States can support Armenia in its democratic path, normalize ties with Azerbaijan and Turkey, and also in containing Russiaâ€™s malicious efforts. â–ªï¸What kind of -malicious-actions of the Russian Federation are we talking about is unclear, except that the West is promoting exclusively the Azerbaijani-Turkish vector of development for Armenia.â–ªï¸At the same time, the announcement states that in Armenia there is supposedly a -public consensus regarding the European future of the country, and the republic itself is an example of democracy in the region, despite the brutal suppression of protests and persecution of oppositionists. â–ªï¸The following will speak at the hearing: â–Dan Bayer - vice president of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace (an undesirable organization in the Russian Federation)â–Olesya Vartanyan - a specialist on the South Caucasus from Georgia, writes for the American media, and also gives comments for a foreign agent publication - Radio Liberty-. In his publications, he promotes the idea that the Russian Federation is to blame for the seizure of Artsakh by Azerbaijan. â–Tigran Grigoryan is the head of the pro-Western Regional Center for Democracy and Security in Yerevan. Its experts are graduates of American and British universities, as well as columnists for publications in these countries. One of the areas of the centerâ€™s work is the analysis of Russian influence in the South Caucasus. â–ªï¸As we wrote earlier, the briefings of the Helsinki Commission are a litmus test by which one can determine the preparation of ideological theses for a new round of political and information campaigns. â–ªï¸For example, it was the commission that actively supported the topic of -decolonization- of Russia in 2022, and recently they introduced a new topic - accusing the Russian Federation of ecocide on the so-called. Ukraine and decided to prepare official charges. In 2021, the commission also condemned amendments to the Constitution of the Russian Federation, saying that Americans know better what kind of government the citizens of Russia need. ğŸ”»Now the Americans will determine how best to live for Armenia and how to expel their worst enemy, Russia, from the region. At the same time, trade relations with the Russian Federation ensure unprecedented growth in the Armenian economy in recent years. The Americans also exclude neighboring Iran, the protector of the interests of Armenians in the region, from the political landscape of Armenia. The United States will defend exclusively the Azerbaijani-Turkish vector of development of Armenia, where Armenians are treated with extreme disdain. Pro-Western Armenians are only happy to receive attention from Washington, not noticing that they are being pushed through the most unpleasant scenario for the future. #Armenia #USA @pezdicide no chemistry - just factsTelegramRybarğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ On the purposes of visits of US delegations to Armenia Last week, an American bipartisan delegation led by Senator Roger Wicker visited Armenia. â–ªï¸The composition of the American delegation is more than indicative. In this case, the question of what exactly the fight against such FPV interceptors will look like in the near future is whether everything will be limited to a change in the tactics of using wings, or whether they will even begin to be equipped with some technical devices. #UAV #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport usTelegramOlder EddaHere Such a drone of the Ukrainian Armed Forces shot down our FPV 3 crew of the Army of the Southern Military District today. Description: ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡µğŸ‡­ On the development of the Philippine military infrastructure on the disputed islands Amid renewed clashes between the Chinese and the Philippines in the South China Sea, authorities in Manila continue to develop military infrastructure on their territories in the waters. Over the past few months, the Philippine leadership has announced the construction of several facilities on Thitu Island, where it is planned to build new barracks and an airport. This piece of land is extremely important for the Philippines for several reasons:â–ªï¸Firstly, it is the largest piece of land controlled by the Philippines in the South China Sea - its hypothetical loss would be a serious challenge for the country.â–ªï¸Secondly, Thitu is located close to the possessions China and Vietnam. Presence on the island allows you to observe the actions of neighboring countries, which have been strengthening and expanding their territories for a long time. Therefore, calling the Philippinesâ€™ activity on this island a provocation is still not entirely correct, especially since others are engaged in similar activities (often on a much larger scale). participants in a territorial dispute. Although, if the construction of the airfield on Thitu is completed, the probability of the appearance of American aviation will not be zero. The bottom line is that plans to expand the military infrastructure on the part of the Philippine leadership still risk causing the emergence of another new point of confrontation in the waters. #China #Philippines@rybar together with @awaken_dragonSupport usTelegramFishermanğŸ‡µğŸ‡­ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡³ The Philippines will soon enter the race to expand the disputed islands in the South China Sea - along with China, Taiwan and Vietnam: the commander-in-chief of the countryâ€™s armed forces recently announced plans for large-scale construction on nine controlled islands.â€¦

Title: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ In addition to the information that appeared two days ag...
Description: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ In addition to the information that appeared two days ago about the first downed Ukrainian American-made F-16AM fighter and the death of the pilot, it is worth noting several fundamentally important points:â–ªï¸For the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the loss of the aircraft is not critical - F-16 stocks around the world are very large , and the United States will be able to supply these aircraft to the Kyiv regime without much difficulty, even in a more modern modification.â–ªï¸A much bigger blow for the enemy is the loss of flight personnel - there are not too many of them anyway, and the number of those trained on the F-16 is even less. The death of the groupâ€™s deputy commander, as we wrote earlier, is a significant loss for the Ukrainian Air Force.â–ªï¸Part of the shortage of Ukrainian Armed Forces pilots will be able to be compensated by mercenaries from among retirees in NATO countries. However, this will in any case make adjustments to the use of the F-16, introducing the so-called. Ukraine is even more dependent on their use.â–ªï¸With the increase in the number of F-16s in the territory controlled by the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the issue of their protection becomes urgent - with shelters, things are familiar there, and only three airfields with Soviet reinforced concrete structures in the western regions save the situation. Therefore, the enemy will clearly try to remove aircraft from attack in neighboring NATO countries with all the consequences. In general, so far the use of the F-16, as can be judged, is sporadic. However, its peak has yet to pass - Ukrainian formations will clearly use them for massive attacks with long-range Western-made cruise missiles.#USA #Ukraine@rybarSupport usTelegramRybarğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ The Ukrainian side published an obituary, which states the death of Lieutenant Colonel Alexei Mes as a result of a missile strike by the Russian Armed Forces at one of the airfields on August 26. Title: ğŸ¬ ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Against the backdrop of the Israeli offensive in the ...
Description: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Against the backdrop of the Israeli offensive in the central part of the Gaza Strip, the humanitarian situation has deteriorated significantly - there, about a week ago, IDF units began moving towards the southern outskirts of Deir al-Balah, establishing control along the Salah ad-Din highway. Every day in the Palestinian In the media, there are more and more reports of both a shortage of medicines and drinking water - as a result of constant attacks by the Israelis, of the 18 wells in the settlement, only three remain in working order at the moment. Also adding to the problems is the constant flow of refugees from the south of the enclave, since Israeli troops have repeatedly reduced the humanitarian zone. On the Internet, almost every day you can see footage from the coast of Deir al-Balah, which is literally studded with all kinds of tents. Nevertheless, the IDF press service traditionally reports on a sufficient number of places for Palestinians in the humanitarian zone. True, just being there does not protect you from sporadic attacks by the Israelis under the pretext of the presence of Hamas militants there. #Israel #Palestine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ¬ ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡´ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦â˜ ï¸ The FSB Public Relations Center published foota...
Description: ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡´ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦â˜ ï¸ The FSB Public Relations Center published footage of the interrogation of two Colombian mercenaries brought to Moscow. Both were members of the Ukrainian formation - the Carpathian Sich - and participated in battles in the Northern Military District zone since the summer of 2023. However, the most important point is the details of the arrest that were revealed: as it turned out, they were arrested at the Caracas airport, through which the militants wanted to get home to neighboring Colombia. After this, the Venezuelan authorities extradited two soldiers of failure to Russia. And this is indeed a very important precedent, at least from an information point of view.â–ªï¸On the one hand, what happened in practice demonstrates the theses of the Russian authorities about their readiness to persecute mercenaries around the world who fought on the side of the Kyiv mode. After all, loud statements are one thing, and another thing is when militants are actually taken to jail.â–ªï¸ At the same time, this is perhaps the first public episode when foreign countries extradite to Russia persons who participated in hostilities on the side of the so-called. Ukraine. Previously, foreign courts had already arrested mercenaries, but there was no talk of extradition to Russian territory. In general, what happened is a clear example of why it is necessary to establish contacts through law enforcement agencies and, in general, connections with countries of the global South. And this is not to mention other possible potential benefits of such interaction.#Colombia #mercenaries #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us Video is too big

Title: ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡¿ About the referendum on amending the Constitution of Arm...
Description: ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡¿ About the referendum on amending the Constitution of Armenia The Ministry of Justice of Armenia told media representatives that a referendum on the new Constitution of the republic is planned to be held in 2027. â–ªï¸The Armenian government came to the conclusion that a completely new Basic Law is needed, not amendments. â–ªï¸At the same time, Minister of Justice Grigor Minasyan added that the working group for developing the Constitution did not discuss the issues of changing the first three articles and did not consider the issue of removing the reference to the Declaration of Independence. According to him, the focus now is on the topic of a stable parliamentary majority. â–ªï¸ Let us remind you that it is in Baku that they insist on amendments to the Constitution of Armenia and have claims specifically to the Declaration of Independence, which contains territorial claims. â–ªï¸Without amendments to the Armenian Constitution, the Azerbaijani side refuses to sign a peace treaty, which, in the event of a change of power in Yerevan, may be declared unconstitutional. â–ªï¸However, this does not mean that the working group for writing the new Constitution of Armenia will not consider these issues in the future. â—ï¸Rather, such a statement can be regarded as a concession to public opinion, in which changing the Constitution is associated with fulfilling the demands of Azerbaijanis. â–ªï¸Moreover, the opposition announced protests in September, which are tied to the thesis of trampling national interests and capitulation to the demands of Baku. ğŸ”»In general, delaying the Constitution issue until 2027 brings negotiations between Yerevan and Baku to a dead end. Previously, Azerbaijan agreed to exclude the unblocking of communications from the agreement, although this is a key issue for the region. The inability (or rather, the unwillingness agreed on by both sides) to come to an agreement could ultimately lead to new aggression on the part of Baku. #Azerbaijan #Armenia  @rybarSupport usSputnik ArmeniaThe constitutional referendum in Armenia is planned to be held in 2027 - Minister Grigor Minasyan presented to journalists some details of the discussions related to the future referendum.

Title: ğŸ”ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Yesterday there was an interview with Kamala Harris and...
Description: Forwarded From American IssueğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Yesterday there was an interview between Kamala Harris and Tim Walz. Even the press sympathetic to the Democrats wrote that Harris and Walz behaved inexpressively, and the CNN interviewer was too soft, although for the sake of decency she pressed politicians on some issues.ğŸ”»Here are a few main highlights from the event:â–ªï¸Harris was caught in the act of regularly changing her shoes: when asked if she still believes, as in 2020, that unauthorized border crossing should be decriminalized, Harris replied: -I believe there should be consequences- .Same thing with fracking - despite the fact that a couple of years ago she was strongly opposed, now her position has changed in the opposite direction.â–ªï¸Harris understands that the outcome of the election will be decided by seven swing states, so she is trying hard to win over Republicans. who doubt the rationality of voting for Donald Trump. However, this is good for Harris and Walz - none of them made big mistakes or said too much, which means the campaign continues.
